files.patch:
@@ -1091,1 +1091,10 @@ - * Initiates handshaking (initial or renegotiation) on this SSLEngine. + * Initiates handshaking on this SSLEngine. Common reasons include a need + * to initiate a new session, to use new encryption keys or to change + * cipher suites. To force complete reauthentication, the current session + * could be invalidated before starting this handshake. + *

+ * The behavior of this method is protocol (and possibly implementation) + * dependent. For example, in TLSv1.3 and later versions calling this + * method after the connection has been established will force producing + * a KeyUpdate message. For prior TLS versions it will force a + * renegotiation (re-handshake).

@@ -505,6 +505,12 @@ - * Starts an SSL handshake on this connection. Common reasons include - * a need to use new encryption keys, to change cipher suites, or to - * initiate a new session. To force complete reauthentication, the - * current session could be invalidated before starting this handshake. - * - *

If data has already been sent on the connection, it continues + * Initiates handshaking on this connection. Common reasons include a need + * to initiate a new session, to use new encryption keys or to change + * cipher suites. To force complete reauthentication, the current session + * could be invalidated before starting this handshake. + *

+ * The behavior of this method is protocol (and possibly implementation) + * dependent. For example, in TLSv1.3 and later versions calling this + * method after the connection has been established will force producing + * a KeyUpdate message. For prior TLS versions it will force a + * renegotiation (re-handshake). + *

+ * If data has already been sent on the connection, it continues @@ -513,1 +519,1 @@ - * + *
